item.title: VIM Cheat Sheet
item.author: mail@richardmillen.com (Richard Millen)
item.description: Multiple Files Buffers Command Info :e foo or :edit foo edit a file in a new buffer :r foo or :read foo or :read !foo read a file or output of shell command :10read foo read and insert file / shell output after line 10 :bn or :bnext switch to the next buffer :bp or :bprev switch to the previous buffer :b4 switch to buffer number 4 :bf switch to first buffer :bl switch to last buffer :b foo<TAB> switch to buffer foo :bd delete a buffer (close a file) :ls or :buffers list all open buffers set hidden hide buffers when abandoned set splitbelow, set splitright new split panes at bottom, right Windows Command Info :sb foo<TAB> split window and edit file / buffer :sp or :sp foo split window in two or edit file in new split window :10sp foo new split 10 lines tall :vs foo<TAB> open a file in a new buffer and vertically split window :vert sb N open buffer #N in left vertical split :vert belowright sb N open buffer #N in right vertical split CTRL-W = normalise split window sizes CTRL-W R swap top/bottom or left/right split CTRL-W T turn window into new tab CTRL-W o close all windows but the current (in the current tab) CTRL-W + or - inc.
